items.title: Trump receives lavish royal welcome on historic UK visit
items.standfirst: President Trump received a lavish royal welcome on his unprecedented second state visit to the U.K. In central London, thousands turned out to protest the visit. NBC News’ Gabe Gutierrez reports.
items.content: President Trump received a lavish royal welcome on his unprecedented second state visit to the U.K. In central London, thousands turned out to protest the visit. NBC News’ Gabe Gutierrez reports.

items.title: Trump attends state banquet at Windsor Castle

items.content: President Trump, King Charles III and others attended a grand banquet at Windsor Castle on Wednesday. CBS News White House reporter Olivia Rinaldi is outside the venue with details.

items.title: King Donald? Britain rolls out royal treatment for Trump
items.standfirst: King Charles to the rescue? The president of the United States wined and dined with all the pomp and circumstance of a state visit to Windsor Castle. We asked about honour guards, flyovers of jets and celebrity royals rolled out to woo a Donald Trump whose world view aligns more with the far-right’s Nigel Farage than with Labour prime minister Keir Starmer.
items.content: King Charles to the rescue? The president of the United States wined and dined with all the pomp and circumstance of a state visit to Windsor Castle. items.title: What does Donald Trump want from his UK state visit?
items.standfirst: And the row over free speech after Charlie Kirk’s assassination

items.title: Royal welcome Trump's UK second state visit, but also protests
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump basked in a British royal spectacle Wednesday, greeted by military honor guards and mounted troops in red and gold as King Charles III's guest at Windsor Castle for the start of a state visit full of pageantry and political risks for the host country. However, Dozens of protesters took to the streets of Windsor before his visit to chant, “Hey, hey, ho, ho, Donald Trump has got to go” and “Donald Trump’s not welcome here.” Philip Turle has more.
items.content: President Donald Trump basked in a British royal spectacle Wednesday, greeted by military honor guards and mounted troops in red and gold as King Charles III's guest at Windsor Castle for the start of a state visit full of pageantry and political risks for the host country. However, Dozens of protesters took to the streets of Windsor before his visit to chant, “Hey, hey, ho, ho, Donald Trump has got to go” and “Donald Trump’s not welcome here.” Philip Turle has more.

items.title: King Charles III gives Donald Trump royal welcome on UK state visit
items.standfirst: Donald Trump was welcomed by King Charles III to Windsor Castle Wednesday with a royal spectacle featuring gun salutes, mounted horses and bagpipes as the US president's historic second state visit got into full swing.
items.content: Donald Trump was welcomed by King Charles III to Windsor Castle Wednesday with a royal spectacle featuring gun salutes, mounted horses and bagpipes as the US president's historic second state visit got into full swing.

items.title: A king, a carriage and an ancient castle greet Trump at historic U.K. visit
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump was granted a royal welcome like no other on Wednesday, greeted by King Charles III and senior royals at Windsor Castle for his unprecedented second state visit.
items.content: President Donald Trump was granted a royal welcome like no other on Wednesday, greeted by King Charles III and senior royals at Windsor Castle for his unprecedented second state visit.

items.title: Trump's historic return to UK: Courting US leader who makes British leaders, citizens deeply uneasy
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump is receiving a lavish welcome at Windsor Castle, beginning a two-day state visit as the guest of King Charles III. Met by royalty, honour guards, and a sweeping military procession, the event includes the largest guard of honour in living memory. As pageantry meets politics, the scale reflects efforts to steady ties with an unpredictable leader whose divisive "America First" stance continues to unsettle global alliances. For deeper insight, beyond the pomp and circumstance, Genie Godula welcomes Quentin Peel, former Foreign Editor at the Financial Times.
items.content: President Donald Trump is receiving a lavish welcome at Windsor Castle, beginning a two-day state visit as the guest of King Charles III. Met by royalty, honour guards, and a sweeping military procession, the event includes the largest guard of honour in living memory. As pageantry meets politics, the scale reflects efforts to steady ties with an unpredictable leader whose divisive "America First" stance continues to unsettle global alliances. For deeper insight, beyond the pomp and circumstance, Genie Godula welcomes Quentin Peel, former Foreign Editor at the Financial Times.

items.title: King Charles III greets Trump in Windsor for his second state visit to the UK
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump was greeted by royalty, military honor guards and mounted troops in red and gold as he arrived at Windsor Castle on Wednesday for the start of a two-day state visit to Britain as the guest of King Charles III.
items.content: President Donald Trump was greeted by royalty, military honor guards and mounted troops in red and gold as he arrived at Windsor Castle on Wednesday for the start of a two-day state visit to Britain as the guest of King Charles III.

items.content: Sir Keir Starmer is under mounting pressure to raise Israel's bombardment of Gaza with Donald Trump during his UK state visit, after a UN Commission said a genocide was taking place.

ai_summary: President Trump received a lavish welcome during his second state visit to the United Kingdom.
Thousands of protesters gathered in London to demonstrate against Trump's visit to the UK.
Trump attended a state banquet at Windsor Castle with King Charles and Melania Trump.
The visit included meetings with the King and potential talks with Keir Starmer.
The UK hopes the visit will encourage Trump to pressure Russia to end the war.

clusters.title: How significant is the Fed's latest rate cut?
clusters.neutral_headline: Federal Reserve Cuts Rates, Signals More Cuts

items.title: How significant is the Fed's latest rate cut?
items.standfirst: The Federal Reserve cut rates for the first time in nine months Wednesday by a quarter point. The decision came as recent employment data showed the U.S. job market might be losing steam. Fed Chair Jerome Powell said there could be even more rate cuts coming later this year. CBS News senior business and technology correspondent Jo Ling Kent reports.
items.content: The Federal Reserve cut rates for the first time in nine months Wednesday by a quarter point. The decision came as recent employment data showed the U.S. job market might be losing steam. Fed Chair Jerome Powell said there could be even more rate cuts coming later this year. CBS News senior business and technology correspondent Jo Ling Kent reports.

items.title: Federal Reserve cuts US interest rates for first time since December
items.standfirst: Central bank moves to set rates at range between 4 and 4.25% but decision unlikely to satisfy Donald TrumpThe US Federal Reserve cut interest rates on Wednesday, its first rate cut since December, as the central bank moved to stabilize a wobbling labor market even as Donald Trump’s tariffs continue to push up prices.Rates are now at a range of 4% to 4.25% – the lowest since November 2022. But the decision is unlikely to satisfy Trump, who has lambasted the Fed for acting “too late” and called for a far bigger cut. Continue reading...
items.content: Central bank moves to set rates at range between 4 and 4.25% but decision unlikely to satisfy Donald TrumpThe US Federal Reserve cut interest rates on Wednesday, its first rate cut since December, as the central bank moved to stabilize a wobbling labor market even as Donald Trump’s tariffs continue to push up prices.Rates are now at a range of 4% to 4.25% – the lowest since November 2022. But the decision is unlikely to satisfy Trump, who has lambasted the Fed for acting “too late” and called for a far bigger cut. Continue reading...

items.content: The central bank’s widely-expected 0.25% cut comes amid a cooling labour market, which has stalled economic growth.

ai_summary: The Federal Reserve cut interest rates by a quarter point, the first cut in nine months.
The rate cut comes amid concerns about a weakening U.S. job market.
Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell indicated more rate cuts could occur later this year.
JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon supports the Federal Reserve's independence.
The UK government said Trump's visit generated 150 billion pounds of investment.

items.content: The widow of #Russian opposition leader Alexei #Navalny spoke out on September 17, claiming she has proof her husband was "poisoned" and directly accusing Vladimir #Putin.

items.content: Yulia Navalnaya is urging the two laboratories she says found her husband was poisoned to release their findings.

items.standfirst: The widow of Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny has said two independent laboratory tests on biological samples taken from her late husband show he was poisoned before his death.
items.content: The widow of Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny has said two independent laboratory tests on biological samples taken from her late husband show he was poisoned before his death.

items.title: Lab tests show Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was poisoned, his wife says
items.standfirst: Tests by two foreign laboratories show that Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was poisoned before his death in an Arctic penal colony last year, his wife said Wednesday
items.content: Tests by two foreign laboratories show that Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was poisoned before his death in an Arctic penal colony last year, his wife said Wednesday

ai_summary: Alexey Navalny's widow says two labs found he was poisoned before his death.
Yulia Navalnaya is urging the labs to release their findings.
Navalny died in an Arctic penal colony in 2024.
Navalny was a vocal critic of the Kremlin and staged anti-Kremlin protests.
The widow directly accused Vladimir Putin of the poisoning.

items.title: RFK Jr.’s biggest disruption yet to vaccine policy is coming
items.standfirst: Former CDC director Susan Monarez testifies at the Senate health committee. | Kevin Dietsch/Getty Images This morning, ousted Centers for Disease Control and Prevention director Susan Monarez came to the Senate to share her story of being fired by US Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F.…
items.content: Former CDC director Susan Monarez testifies at the Senate health committee. | Kevin Dietsch/Getty Images This morning, ousted Centers for Disease Control and Prevention director Susan Monarez came to the Senate to share her story of being fired by US Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F.…

items.title: Former CDC Director Monarez pushes back on RFK Jr.'s explanation for her firing
items.standfirst: Former CDC Director Susan Monarez on Wednesday told a Senate committee on Wednesday her side of getting fired by Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. CBS News congressional correspondent Caitlin Huey-Burns reports.
items.content: Former CDC Director Susan Monarez on Wednesday told a Senate committee on Wednesday her side of getting fired by Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. CBS News congressional correspondent Caitlin Huey-Burns reports.

items.title: Why RFK Jr. Fired His Own Pick for CDC Director
items.standfirst: Susan Monarez was confirmed as Director of Centers for Disease Control and Prevention less than two months ago. She lasted 29 days.
items.content: Susan Monarez was confirmed as Director of Centers for Disease Control and Prevention less than two months ago. She lasted 29 days.

items.title: Watch: Tim Kaine apologizes to ex-CDC director for questioning her backbone during confirmation
items.standfirst: Democratic Sen. Tim Kaine apologized to former CDC Director Susan Monarez for questioning her backbone to stand up to the Trump administration if necessary. Monarez appeared before the Senate Health Committee to testify about her firing.
items.content: Democratic Sen. Tim Kaine apologized to former CDC Director Susan Monarez for questioning her backbone to stand up to the Trump administration if necessary. Monarez appeared before the Senate Health Committee to testify about her firing.

items.title: Doctor recaps former CDC Director Susan Monarez's Senate testimony
items.standfirst: Former CDC Director Susan Monarez testified before lawmakers on Capitol Hill on Wednesday in the wake of her firing in August. CBS News medical contributor Dr. Céline Gounder joins to discuss the moments that stood out to her.
items.content: Former CDC Director Susan Monarez testified before lawmakers on Capitol Hill on Wednesday in the wake of her firing in August. CBS News medical contributor Dr. Céline Gounder joins to discuss the moments that stood out to her.

items.title: Fired CDC Director Says RFK Jr. Pressured Her to Blindly Approve Vaccine Changes
items.standfirst: Susan Monarez told a Senate committee that Robert F. Kennedy Jr. demanded she dismiss career officials without cause—and accept vaccine recommendations regardless of whether science backed them up.
items.content: Susan Monarez told a Senate committee that Robert F. Kennedy Jr. demanded she dismiss career officials without cause—and accept vaccine recommendations regardless of whether science backed them up.

items.title: Ousted CDC Director Susan Monarez testifies about RFK Jr., vaccines

items.title: Florida puts man to death in state record 12th execution this year
items.standfirst: David Pittman, 63, convicted in 1991 of killing three people, executed after final appeal rejected by US supreme courtA Florida man convicted of killing his estranged wife’s sister and parents and setting their house on fire was put to death on Wednesday evening, a record 12th execution in the state in 2025.David Pittman, 63, was pronounced dead at 6.12pm local time following a lethal injection at Florida state prison near Starke, under a death warrant signed by Governor Ron DeSantis. Florida’s Republican governor has signed more death warrants this year than any of his predecessors. Continue reading...
items.content: David Pittman, 63, convicted in 1991 of killing three people, executed after final appeal rejected by US supreme courtA Florida man convicted of killing his estranged wife’s sister and parents and setting their house on fire was put to death on Wednesday evening, a record 12th execution in the state in 2025.David Pittman, 63, was pronounced dead at 6.12pm local time following a lethal injection at Florida state prison near Starke, under a death warrant signed by Governor Ron DeSantis. Florida’s Republican governor has signed more death warrants this year than any of his predecessors. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: Erika McEntarfer says Americans should be concerned about independence of key economic institutionsThe former chief US economics data statistics who Donald Trump fired last month called her sudden removal “dangerous” and said Americans should be concerned about the independence of key economic institutions.“Markets have to trust the data are not manipulated,” said Erika McEntarfer, the former head of the Bureau Labor of Statistics, in her first remarks since her firing. “Firing your chief statisticians for releasing data you do not like, it has serious economic consequences.” Continue reading...

items.title: Hundreds of Machu Picchu tourists stranded
items.standfirst: Hundreds of tourists have been left stranded near Peru's ancient Inca citadel of Machu Picchu after rail services were suspended because protesters blocked the route with rocks.
items.content: Hundreds of tourists have been left stranded near Peru's ancient Inca citadel of Machu Picchu after rail services were suspended because protesters blocked the route with rocks.

items.title: Rocks on train tracks strand 900 Machu Picchu tourists amid protest
items.standfirst: About 1,400 visitors were evacuated but hundreds were left stuck because of action linked to bus contract dispute, say Peru authoritiesAt least 900 tourists were stranded near the ancient Inca citadel of Machu Picchu on Tuesday, Peru’s tourism minister said, after a passenger train service was suspended due to a protest.PeruRail said service was suspended on Monday because the route in Peru’s mountainous Cusco region had been blocked by “rocks of various sizes” as residents clashed with authorities and bus companies. PeruRail’s local unit also said “third parties” had excavated part of its rail route, which affected the track’s stability and slowed down the evacuation of tourists. Continue reading...
items.content: About 1,400 visitors were evacuated but hundreds were left stuck because of action linked to bus contract dispute, say Peru authoritiesAt least 900 tourists were stranded near the ancient Inca citadel of Machu Picchu on Tuesday, Peru’s tourism minister said, after a passenger train service was suspended due to a protest.PeruRail said service was suspended on Monday because the route in Peru’s mountainous Cusco region had been blocked by “rocks of various sizes” as residents clashed with authorities and bus companies. PeruRail’s local unit also said “third parties” had excavated part of its rail route, which affected the track’s stability and slowed down the evacuation of tourists. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Hundreds of tourists were stranded near Machu Picchu.
Rail services were suspended due to protests.
Protesters blocked the route with rocks.
About 900 tourists were stranded.
Authorities evacuated approximately 1,400 visitors.

clusters.title: Trump announces deadly US strike on another alleged Venezuelan drug boat
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump announces strike on Venezuelan boat

items.title: Trump announces deadly US strike on another alleged Venezuelan drug boat
items.standfirst: President says three people killed in strike against vessel he said was transporting drugs ‘headed to the US’Donald Trump said on Monday that the United States had carried out a strike on a second Venezuelan boat and killed three alleged terrorists he claimed were transporting drugs, expanding his administration’s war against drug cartels and the scope of lethal military force to stop them.The US president gave few details about the strike, saying in a social media post that the action was on his orders and that it had happened earlier in the morning. The post was accompanied by a video clip showing the boat, which appeared to be stationary, erupting into a fireball. Continue reading...
items.content: President says three people killed in strike against vessel he said was transporting drugs ‘headed to the US’Donald Trump said on Monday that the United States had carried out a strike on a second Venezuelan boat and killed three alleged terrorists he claimed were transporting drugs, expanding his administration’s war against drug cartels and the scope of lethal military force to stop them.The US president gave few details about the strike, saying in a social media post that the action was on his orders and that it had happened earlier in the morning. The post was accompanied by a video clip showing the boat, which appeared to be stationary, erupting into a fireball. Continue reading...

items.title: U.S. military targets a second alleged Venezuelan drug boat
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump alleged that "narcoterrorists" were on the boat and that they were carrying illegal drugs destined for the United States.
items.content: President Donald Trump alleged that "narcoterrorists" were on the boat and that they were carrying illegal drugs destined for the United States.

ai_summary: Donald Trump announced a strike on a Venezuelan boat.
The strike killed three alleged drug traffickers.
Trump said the boat was transporting drugs.
The strike was part of the war against drug cartels.
Trump gave few details about the strike.
